results.title: Providence
results.creator_credit: Alain Resnais, Philippe Dussart, Action Film, Citel, FR3 and Societe Francaise de Production
results.brief_description: This is a perversely hilarious comedy about one restless night (among many) in the fading life of an ageing, over-sexed novelist, Clive Langham. Clive lives alone in a country mansion and spends his nights cursing his fate as he inserts suppositories, sits on the “throne” and downs bottle after bottle of white wine. A well acted study in the lack of communication. Stars Sir John Gielgud, Dirk Bogarde and Ellen Burstyn.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Resnais, Philippe Dussart, Action Film, Citel, FR3 and Societe Francaise de Production

results.title: Une Parisienne
results.creator_credit: Michael Boisrand, Francis Cosne, Cinetel, Filmsonor, Les Films Ariane and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Brigitte Laurier is the beautiful daughter of the French Premier. When she is found, quite innocently, in bed with Michel, the Premier’s principal secretary, a quick marriage seems to be the only solution to save appearances. In this lighthearted French comedy, a royal flirtation may not be the only thing in the way of married bliss. Stars Charles Boyer and Brigitte Bardot. Dubbed into English

results.title: Babette's Feast = Babettes Gaestebud
results.creator_credit: Gabriel Axel, Bo Christensen, Just Betzer, Danish Film Institute, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Panorama Film A/S
results.brief_description: Exquisitely, delicately told tale of two beautiful young daughters of a minister, who pass up love and fame to remain in their small Danish village. They grow old, using religion as a substitute for living life … and then take in Babette, a Parisian refugee, a woman with a very special secret. Babette wins 10,000 francs in a lottery and spends it all on preparing a sumptuous banquet for her Lutheran employers and their friends. Based on a short story by Isak Dinesen (Karen Blixen). Stars Stephane Audran in the title role with Jean-Philippe Lafont, Jarl Kulle and Bibi Andersson.

results.title: Jubilee
results.brief_description: Queen Elizabeth I is transported by her astrologer into the latter part of the 20th century, and is appalled by what she sees in this punk rock era. Outrageous dissection of modern urban life, full of black jokes, it has the right attitudes but is not free of a determination to shock at all costs.

results.title: Mapantsula
results.creator_credit: Oliver Schmitz, Max Montocchio, David Hannay and Haverbeam
results.brief_description: The lives of Black South Africans in the township of Soweto are the background to this powerful, absorbing and thoughtful film. It is the first international Black African feature film and it was made under the noses of South African authorities, who thought it was a gangster film. Unlike many political films, “Mapantsula” is a story viewed through the eyes of an anti-hero, a small time black gangster known to his friends as Panic. Panic is a smooth opportunist who takes down anyone, white or black. In Zulu, Sotho and Afrikaans with English subtitles.

results.title: Kagemusha
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, TCF and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Kagemusha means “The double”, and refers to the practice used by Japanese warlords of employing others to impersonate themselves during battles. In this film, a thief about to be executed is reprieved and given the task of impersonating one such man. When the latter dies, the impersonation continues, until he is unmasked, whereupon the story moves on to explore the end of a warrior clan. An impressive, lavish work. Also known as “The double” or “Shadow warrior”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Akira Kurosawa, TCF and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha

results.title: Hail Mary = Je Vous salue Marie
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Channel 4, Gaumont-British Instructional and Television Romande
results.brief_description: This amazingly moving, funny yet disturbing, richly human film has aroused passionate feelings right around the world. Mary, the young daughter of a petrol station owner who is just beginning to discover womanhood, and her taxi driver, Joseph, try to grapple with her unexplained pregnancy.

results.title: Le Chant du Monde
results.creator_credit: Marcel Camus, Claire Duval, Michel Choquet, Films Marceau, Liber Films and Orphee Productions
results.brief_description: In Haute-Provence, two rival clans are in constant battle against one another. In the midst of this conflict, a passionate love affair unfolds. Stars Catherine Deneuve, Hardy Kruger, Charles Vanel. Based on a novel by Jean Giono.

results.title: Cartouche = Swords of Blood
results.creator_credit: Philippe De Broca, Georges Dancigers, Ariane, Filmsonor and VIDES Cinematografica
results.brief_description: Jean-Paul Belmondo is a good-hearted thief operating in 18th century Paris. He teams up with Venus, a gipsy pickpocket (Claudia Cardinale), overthrows the leader of the pickpocket gang (Marcel Dalio) and turns it into a crime syndicate that gives the fancy baubles of the rich to the poor. “Cartouche” encompasses tragedy, farce and violence in a popular, high-flown adventure.

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Carlos Saura, Emiliano Piedra, Emiliano Productions and Television Espanola
results.brief_description: A Spanish flamenco ballet company is trying to create a dance version of “Carmen” out of the Bizet opera, Merimee’s story and flamenco guitar music. Choreographer, Antonio, discovers an unknown girl to play the central role, a woman with a husband in prison. He becomes infatuated with her. But soon the legend of “Carmen” begins to assert itself.
